intro: Nauclea gageana, commonly known as the Natal flame tree, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has pinnate leaves with small, elliptical leaflets and produces small, dark blue to black berries. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soils, making it a popular ornamental plant in tropical and subtropical regions. Nauclea gageana is also valued for its ability to attract birds and insects due to its showy flowers and nutritious fruits.
